text:
James Ratcliffe – AMIChemE  
10 Lindsay Gardens, Gilletts Lane, High Wycombe, HP12 4BB   
james.ratcliffe95@gmail.com   07837122546   linkedin.com/in/ james -r95 
 
Profile              
I am assertive an d driven Process Engineer with  experience working on a variety of projects  to drive 
process improvements  and enhance designs within the Potable Water  and the Oil and Gas  Industry .  I 
have proven experience producing solutions  through optimisations  whilst managing and meeting the 
requirements of multiple stakeholders. I am eager  for a  new opportunity to utilise my skills and 
knowledge where I can make a meaningful contribution towards  driving sustainability solutions to help 
solve both business and climate change challenges.

james.ratcliffe95@gmail.com   07837122546   linkedin.com/in/ james -r95 
 
Profile              
I am assertive an d driven Process Engineer with  experience working on a variety of projects  to drive 
process improvements  and enhance designs within the Potable Water  and the Oil and Gas  Industry .  I 
have proven experience producing solutions  through optimisations  whilst managing and meeting the 
requirements of multiple stakeholders. I am eager  for a  new opportunity to utilise my skills and 
knowledge where I can make a meaningful contribution towards  driving sustainability solutions to help 
solve both business and climate change challenges.  
 
Education             
2013–2017  The University of Sheffield  
MEng (Hons) Che mical Engineering              Obtained Result: 1st 
Research Project:  
• Developing low cost and renewable heterogeneous cata lysts for biodiesel production . 
• Synthesised  and optimised  various catalysts and developed  and trialled  a scale up procedure . 
Design Project:  
• Designed a bioethanol fermentation and separation plant in a team of engineers, incorporating 
novel microbubble distillation and condensation  technology . Independently produced detailed 
design of the fermentation unit and plant layout.  
2006–2013  Macclesfield High School/ College  
  A Level s – Mathematics (B), Chemistry (B), Biology (B)  
  AS Level s – Product Design (B)  
  GCSE s – 14 (2A*, 6A, 6B) including Maths and English  
Relevant  Experience            
Aug 2019  – Present   Process  Engineer – Wood PLC  
Developed my core process engineering competencies on two world scale FEED project s; designing 
a Natural Gas Fractionation facility to be built in the Middle East  and a separate PMC role on a project  
to design a n olefin complex in Belgium.   Currently d eveloping a company -wide framework for 
embedding sustainability and reliability within i nfrastructure projects.  
• Actively engage d with a range of stakeholders of varying seniority within the business to gain 
‘buy-in’ and manage strong working relationships to progress a Framework I am developing to 
embed Sustainability and Reliability into inf rastructure projects.  Developing materials to 
demonstrate current inhouse capabilities and experience to clients.  
• Responsible for performing adequacy studies on existing NGL fractionation facilities processing a 
change in mixed feed composition. Developed a Hysys simulation to benchmark existing 
performance and reviewed as -built equipment design documentation to ident ify bottlenecks and 
identify potential mitigat ion options for the client to pursue.  
• Performed study assessments to determine optimum configuration of a compressed air system 
considering, CAPEX, OPEX, plot space and safety considerations.  
• Performed variou s technology and licensor evaluations considering technical feasibility and 
economic assessments to enable clients to confidently make informed decisions.  Examples 
include spent caustic treatment technologies  and licensed sulfur removal units.  
• Developed  and reviewed key engineering deliverables , such as; Basis of Design (BOD) , Process 
Drawings and Equipment Datasheets . 
• Won first place  in the Associate of Project Management Challenge 2020 , initiating and 
developing a project to deliver grow kits, an  info pack  and lesson to educate children on 
sustainable growing.  As the commercial  lead, I ensured delivery of the project on time and within 
budget.  
 
Sept 2017 – Aug 2019  Graduate Engineer – Affinity Water  
Gained valuable experience u ndertaking a range of  roles / projects on a two year  graduate schem e. 
Process Optimisation P roject  
• Lead a process optimisation project assessing  the performance of  a potable  water treatment site 
in terms of operating costs, process and product quality.  Established a methodology that has 
been adopted as the standard company approach  taken  by other  optimisation engineers . 
• Identified a series of solutions to mitigate inefficienc ies, reducing power  consumption , increasing

Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
